trans-unit.source: Provides runtime versions 1.0 and 1.1 support for reading configuration sections and common configuration settings.

Using the static methods and properties of the <xref:System.Configuration.ConfigurationSettings> type is the recommended method for reading configuration information at runtime for versions 1.0 and 1.1 applications.
The <xref:System.Configuration.ConfigurationSettings> class provides backward compatibility only.
For new applications you should use the <xref:System.Configuration.ConfigurationManager> class or <xref:System.Web.Configuration.WebConfigurationManager> class instead.
To use these two classes, you must add a reference in your project or application to the System.Configuration namespace.
Gets a read-only <xref href="System.Collections.Specialized.NameValueCollection"></xref> of the application settings section of the configuration file.
The `appSettings` section element of the configuration file contains a series of name/value pairs that your application can use for any purpose.
This method is deprecated and is maintained for backward compatibility.
Please use the GetSection method instead.
The <xref:System.Configuration.ConfigurationSettings> class provides backward compatibility only.
You should use the <xref:System.Configuration.ConfigurationManager> class or <xref:System.Web.Configuration.WebConfigurationManager> class instead.
A read-only <xref href="System.Collections.Specialized.NameValueCollection"></xref> of the application settings section from the configuration file.
Returns the <xref href="System.Configuration.ConfigurationSection"></xref> object for the passed configuration section name and path.
This method is deprecated and is maintained for backward compatibility.
Please use the GetSection method instead.
A configuration name and path, such as "system.net/settings".
The <xref href="System.Configuration.ConfigurationSection"></xref> object for the passed configuration section name and path.
The <xref href="System.Configuration.ConfigurationSettings"></xref> class provides backward compatibility only.
You should use the <xref href="System.Configuration.ConfigurationManager"></xref> class or <xref href="System.Web.Configuration.WebConfigurationManager"></xref> class instead.
Unable to retrieve the requested section.
